author: protolambda
content:
**Configuration**: https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-testnets/tree/master/shared/prater
**Explorer**: https://prater.beaconcha.in/

F.A.Q.:
**How many validators?**: 210000 validators. At genesis mostly a dev-net: 40k EF (10k per client type), 40K per client dev team (Lighthouse, Nimbus, Prysm, Teku), 1K for Lodestar (to scale up later), 5K Sifrai, 2K JGM, 1K Explorer, 1K Unvetica
**When deposit CLI?**: see v1.1.1 "A Prater Starter"
**When public?**: Already public, but developer-focused to begin. 210k validators is uncharted, unstable, territory
**When launchpad?**: Soon ‚Ñ¢Ô∏è
**Prater-compatible client releases**:
  - Lighthouse: v1.2.1 *Catogami* - https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/releases/tag/v1.2.1
  - Lodestar v0.18.0 - https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/releases/tag/v0.18.0
  - Nimbus: v1.0.11 - https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/releases/tag/v1.0.11
  - Prysm: v1.3.4 - https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/releases/tag/v1.3.4
  - Teku: v21.3.0 - https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/releases/tag/21.3.0

author: protolambda
content:
- unvetica: offline till network update, just 1k out of 210k, all good
- Sifrai: updating their nodes
- Nimbus: hit 2 epoch delay due to doppelganger detection, and missed genesis edge case. Safety first...

content: So first 2 epochs the effective rate was 46/210=22% missing, the rest seems to be due to warm-up problems and/or load

author: protolambda
content: it may be due to different handling of the genesis state, and copy-voting if the block is deemed valid but within range. The spec says to not copy valid votes in the first part of the voting period, so that may have caused the 2nd hash to gain votes

author: ppf.
content: we underestimated what it means to have 200k validators instead of 100k üòÑ

author: ppf.
content: prysm is doing ok for serving data to our explorer, db is the bottleneck

author: ajsutton
content: The point was to go big and see what breaks. üôÇ

author: ppf.
content: we scaled the db now, will see how it goes - sorry for the inconvenience

author: ppf.
content: i turned off pyrmont for a little bit

author: ppf.
content: expecting to be okish with scaled db and with some improvements to our exporter we should be fine again

author: potuz
content: I think a bit of non-finality will really show what breaks

author: potuz
content: Have been advocating this on pyrmont. It may happen without intervention

author: ajsutton
content:
True, I think that's potentially useful on Pyrmont but I also don't think we'd see the exceptionally long non-finality we had on Medalla with MainNet because real money is at stake so once a fix is available most people will apply it.  And we've already seen shorter periods of non-finality on Pyrmont that didn't cause any issue.
So while there's some potential for black swan type events still I think we've actually covered the most likely scenarios reasonably well.

author: potuz
content: Pyrmont (or at least in combination with mainnet) has already kicked some validators out (eg. me). Without finalizing we'll see how RAM hungry clients really are

author: potuz
content: <@!399309815517544451> prysm is still on the same percentage, out of the last 360 blocks, 75 were by prysm, 40 of which were on the right block
